annotation.TEXT: Be sure to hit this blue gate switch.
Whoa, I almost boiled away my last sliver of health at the end there. That would've sucked if I had died right there.
And, for this last part, I think you do need to circle around and kill the slime that's weighing down the balance box on the right.
And now it's not blowing that whistle anymore. It only did it the first time, and that was it. Yeah, I don't know why it did that. Anyway, let's finish the level now.
Okay, that should do. Now for this challenge, you have 12 seconds to defeat 3 of these bats.
Okay, yeah. I'm just gonna start over after that awful start.
Perfect! Now I can grab the final gem and finish the level! BTW, you don't have to nudge the block slightly first like I did there. You can just slam it right away and that should work just fine.
Now, with those blocks out of my way, I can go up and hit this yellow star switch, opening a gate that's blocking the second gem.
Lush!
Whoa, that bat just shattered. However, that's just a special effect due to the costume I'm using. Daria would've one-shotted that bat regardless of which outfit she was wearing.
Alright, that'll be all for this episode! Next time may or may not feature a boss battle, depending on the votes! To be continued... Yo!
Alright, I think I'm done here. Let's return to our regularly scheduled watermelon now.
SLAMMIN'!
And, as you just saw there, we have a new type of bat enemy that explodes into 8 fireballs when destroyed. Try to make sure you have ample room to avoid those when you destroy these bats.
Ack! Okay, this is not going well!
Very good. Now, the final gem is right there, but it's possible to screw yourself out of it if you do this part wrong.
So... Can I manage to get this gem without becoming a shishkebab?
Then, just dodge the solitary Podoboo while grabbing the second gem.
Aha! Yep, Podoboos can break those blocks. Also, the bats' fireballs can break them too, but that doesn't come up in this level. It will in other levels, though.
Okay, the red Thermal Discouragement Beam (TDB) is now hitting the A node, which opens the A gate, and that's normal.
Hot, hot, hot...
I got poked once, but I got the gem and escaped alive!
Fast... FORWARD!!!
And now let's resume our adventure with 4-7, which involves nice warm lava. Oh, and let's use one of the new costumes too.
Alright, let's combo together some more bats. Daria heals a little bit with each kill she gets with her lasers, so I might be able to take advantage of lava to recover mana during this combo.
Okay, so now I'm back on my in-progress file here. (I was using my 100% file for that 4-B revisit, although I guess I didn't need to.)
Already off to a much better start. Remember not to lower the first balance box all the way to the floor, or you'll have to waste time raising it back up.

Next, we have this thingamajig. Stand on the purple button and use the mouse wheel to move the platform out of the way, but do note that it'll gradually fall back down into its original position on its own.
C-C-C-C-Combo breaker! (4 kills, 5000 points.)
Oh, what's this? The A node is still active even though there's no longer a TDB hitting it, and the A gate is still open. That's weird.
Wait, does this mean that most of this puzzle is pointless? Let me move the green block back in the way of the red TDB.
There's a red ! switch in the lava above, so I can potentially extend this combo further...
Let me just kill these guys real quick, and then I'll try hitting a green Luigi switch...

Very good. BTW, you might have noticed that the bats' fireballs disappeared upon hitting the lava, and destroying a submerged bat resulted in no fireballs appearing from it. That can be handy to know.
Oh, man. New castle-like area, with new music. So, yeah, I'm using trumpet Mira here, and shooting makes trumpet sound effects.
So, what you want to do is slam that gravblock as hard as you can!
Hello, and welcome back to Miracle Fly! Now, before I resume the adventure, I want to double-check something here in 4-B...
Awesome combo! (8 kills, 18,000 points.)
And now I'm briefly forgetting what I need to do.
Anyway, let's get out of here. I have to hit this timer switch and then head to the exit quickly...
Yeah, I remember now. This gem is well-hidden, and I really hope I have enough HP to get it without dying...
This purple button controls this pendulum, and while you could just nudge the gravity block to the right to open up the path to the exit, merely doing that will result in the gem being blocked.
Also, if you want, you can vote on which costumes you want me to wear next time too. (I've provided a link to the costume video I made in the description.)
Whoa, that tiny bat is wiggling out in the corner for some reason. Well, blast him, then retreat out of the passage to dodge the incoming fireball.
Well, let's see what happens if I move this green block out of the way of the Podoboos...
DOUBLE KILL!
Ow, ow, ow...

I was pretty sure that the letter switches and nodes are supposed to only be active while something is continuously pressing/hitting them, and should deactivate when they're no longer being pressed/hit...

Now, while lava does hurt, one nice thing about it is that it doesn't break your kill combo, and also, it refills your mana the same way water does, so you can take advantage of that if you have plenty of HP.
And, there we go! That was pretty good, although I imagine that it's certainly possible to break 6000.
Oh, man... Now we've got Podoboos, AKA Lava Bubbles, which I guess is their official name, but who calls them that? Well, whatever they're called, try to avoid them.
...Huh? Why did a whistle blow when I hit the timer switch there? It sounded like the whistle that occurs if you time out on a red ! challenge, but I already succeeded at that earlier. Weird.
Oh, doing that made the game realize that there was no longer a TDB hitting the A node, and deactivated it, closing the A gate.

Okay, so what I want to check involves the A node and A gate, and how the A gate remained open even after I switched which Thermal Discouragement Beams were active, which should've disabled the A gate.
Yeah, lava gradually depletes your health while you're in it, so don't stay in it for too long. But, other than the HP drain, lava acts like normal water.
Whoa, geez. I was snagging on corners as I was trying to get out there, and if that rotating door had shoved me back down into the lava there, I probably would've perished.
Hmm... I wonder if I should've held off on grabbing that health potion for the moment...
Okay, let's see if I can get some mana back with minimal loss of HP here...
1 vote for more Luigi buttons, 1 vote to call the lasers Thermal Discouragement Beams, 0 votes for the upper path, and 3 votes for the lower path! So, 4-8 is next, with Knight Daria!

Okay, so... it seems there's a glitch, where the game doesn't recognize that there's no longer a TDB hitting the A node when I just switch the active TDB color like that. I wonder if that could be used to break puzzles elsewhere...
Wait, why am I wasting time going for those coins?
Looks like we're gonna have to take a dip in lava here.
Wow, that sucked, but I'm still alive, and safe from the Podoboos while standing on this purple button here, which I'll use to rotate the door above.
Oh, man. That unlocked the boss level. So guys, place your votes for either 4-9 (Bat Pack) or 4-BOSS (The King of Bat)!
Oh, boy... Here's another one of these thingamajigs, along with one of the trickiest gems to get in the game.
Now, let's end this video by Time Attacking 1-C with Firefighter Irvette!
Anyway, with this new area comes new elements. First, there's the warm lava.
Okay, I got out of there, and I think that's it for the most dangerous stuff in this level. Now, up above, there are these cracked blocks, but my shots can't break them. Whatever shall I do?
Super combo! (4 kills, 5000 points.)
Alright, that unlocked two more levels, 4-9 above, and 4-8 below. Now I did ask you guys to vote on which path to travel next, so here are the results...
Oh, hold on. That was the third gem? Well, then where's the second gem? It's gotta be back here somewhere.
So yeah, the costumes don't do anything to affect actual gameplay mechanics, just so that's clear.
Out of mana, but there's lava right there. But, there are also Podoboos...
